title: L-3 Nozzlenose D
content:
The L-3 Nozzlenose D is a main weapon in the Splatoon series. It is an alternative version of the L-3 Nozzlenose.

The L-3 Nozzlenose D in Splatoon and Splatoon 2 is nearly identical in appearance to the L-3 Nozzlenose, with the only difference being the presence of its manufacturer's dolphin decal on the hose.

In Splatoon 3, the L-3 Nozzlenose D has undergone a noticeable visual change, setting it further apart from its standard counterpart: its build is now significantly lighter in color, with most of the frame becoming white and all of the darker blue elements shifting to a significantly lighter shade. It retains the dolphin decal.

The L-3 Nozzlenose D was released on 29 August 2015 at 02:00 UTC.[1] It has the same stats as its base weapon, the L-3 Nozzlenose, but comes with Burst Bombs and the Kraken.

- The L-3 Nozzlenose D is a middleweight weapon.

- Each shot consumes 1% of the ink tank capacity.
This allows players to fire 100 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This allows players to fire 100 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When pressing , three shots will be fired at a time, as long as there is enough ink to fire all three.
If there is not enough ink to fire all three shots, then zero, one or two shots will be fired instead, depending on how much ink is left in the ink tank.

- If there is not enough ink to fire all three shots, then zero, one or two shots will be fired instead, depending on how much ink is left in the ink tank.

- When firing a burst, a shot is fired every 4 frames.

- After the last shot in a burst is fired, another burst cannot be fired for 8 frames.

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.5 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 25 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 29.

- Shots travel straight for 5 frames. After that, they may lose damage. A shot will lose damage until it reaches 14.5 damage at frame 15.

- Shots have a radius of 2 units.

- The angle its shots can deviate while on the ground is 1 degrees.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 6 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. The outer reticle will finish shrinking after 60 frames.

- The chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle increases by 2% per shot, and maximizes at a 25% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle.
This means that it takes 13 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- This means that it takes 13 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 40%.

- Accuracy starts recovering 4 frames after the player stops shooting.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 22 units per frame for 5 frames. Shots travel straight for 110 distance units.

- Ink droplets occur every 116 units.

- The frequency at which ink drips from a shot occurs at a rate of 1.5 droplets per shot.

- There are a total of 10 different droplet patterns that can be created while firing this weapon.

- Droplets that occur within 11 units of the player have a radius of 23 units.

- Droplets that occur when they travel past 200 units of the player have a radius of 23 units.

- All other ink droplets have a radius of 16 units.

- This allows players to fire 100 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- If there is not enough ink to fire all three shots, then zero, one or two shots will be fired instead, depending on how much ink is left in the ink tank.

- This means that it takes 13 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

[2]

- ▲ Ink coverage increased by 10%.

- ▼ Special gauge loss: 50% → 60%.

- ▲ Damage to the Rainmaker shield increased by about 20%.

The L-3 Nozzlenose D is a standard L-3 Nozzlenose, decorated with badges from its manufacturer. Its stats are unchanged, but this set includes Burst Bombs and the Kraken - an aggressive combination! Attack with a Burst Bomb, and then finish them with your shooter. It's an easy set to get the hang of!(NA)

- Promotional image

- An Inkling standing with the L-3 Nozzlenose D equipped.

- Firing the L-3 Nozzlenose D in Blackbelly Skatepark. (behind)

- Official art of an Inkling holding the L-3 Nozzlenose D.

- SplatNet icon

The L-3 Nozzlenose D was released on 6 January 2018 at 02:00 UTC.[3] It comes with Burst Bombs and the Inkjet.

- The L-3 Nozzlenose D is a middleweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 135. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The ink consumption of 1.15% and ink tank capacity of 100% allows players to fire 86 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When initially firing the weapon in humanoid form, the first shot takes 3 frames to come out.

- When firing from swim form, the first shot takes 12 frames to come out.

- When pressing , three shots will be fired at a time, as long as there is enough ink to fire all three.
If there is not enough ink to fire all three shots, then zero, one or two shots will be fired instead, depending on how much ink is left in the ink tank.

- If there is not enough ink to fire all three shots, then zero, one or two shots will be fired instead, depending on how much ink is left in the ink tank.

- When firing a burst, a shot is fired every 4 frames.

- After the last shot in a burst is fired, another burst cannot be fired for 8 frames.

- When a burst is started, it takes 21 frames before the user can enter swim form or use their sub weapon.

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.8 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 25 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 29.

- If a shot is in the air for more than 8 frames after being fired, it loses 0.90625 damage per frame until it reaches 14.5 damage at frame 24.

- The bullet hitbox has a radius of 2 units.

- The angle its shots can deviate while on the ground is 1 degrees.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 6 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. After 25 frames, the outer reticle will start shrinking, and will finish shrinking after 70 frames.

- The L-3 Nozzlenose D starts off having a 1% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle.
This chance increases by 1% per shot, and maximizes at a 25% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle, meaning that it takes 24 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- This chance increases by 1% per shot, and maximizes at a 25% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle, meaning that it takes 24 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 40%.

- Accuracy starts recovering 4 frames after the player stops shooting. The chance to shoot towards the outer reticle decreases by 0.5% per frame, if the chance is not already at the minimum, meaning that it takes 52 frames to reach maximum accuracy. (82 after shooting while jumping.)

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 27.5 units per frame for 4 frames. Shots travel straight for 110 distance units.
After that, the shot's velocity is set to 15.68 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 15.68 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- Ink droplets occur every 120 units.

- The frequency at which ink drips from a shot occurs at a rate of 1.5 droplets per shot.

- There are a total of 12 different droplet patterns that can be created while firing this weapon.

- Droplets that occur within 11 units of the player have a radius of 19.5 units, and a width of 10 units.
These droplets have their radius multiplied by a value ranging from 1.2 if they fell from a height above 100 units to 1.4 if they fell from a height below 30 units.

- These droplets have their radius multiplied by a value ranging from 1.2 if they fell from a height above 100 units to 1.4 if they fell from a height below 30 units.

- Droplets that occur when they travel past 200 units of the player have a radius of 19.5 units.

- All other ink droplets have a radius of 15.5 units.

- Droplets that are far from the player and all other droplets have their radius multiplied by a value ranging from 1 if they fell from a height above 100 units to 1.2 if they fell from a height below 30 units.

- If no ink droplets have occurred within 11 units of the player for 3 shots, the next shot the player makes will force a paint droplet to appear at the player's feet. This ensures that the player's feet will always be inked after three bursts.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- If there is not enough ink to fire all three shots, then zero, one or two shots will be fired instead, depending on how much ink is left in the ink tank.

- This chance increases by 1% per shot, and maximizes at a 25% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle, meaning that it takes 24 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 15.68 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- These droplets have their radius multiplied by a value ranging from 1.2 if they fell from a height above 100 units to 1.4 if they fell from a height below 30 units.

[4][5]

- ▲ Increased bullet velocity by roughly 25% without changing shot distance.
Initial bullet velocity: 22 units/frame → 27.5 units/frame.
Frames a shot travels straight: 5 frames → 4 frames.
Time before a shot's damage starts decreasing: 9 frames → 8 frames.
Time to reach minimum damage: 25 frames → 24 frames.

- Initial bullet velocity: 22 units/frame → 27.5 units/frame.

- Frames a shot travels straight: 5 frames → 4 frames.

- Time before a shot's damage starts decreasing: 9 frames → 8 frames.

- Time to reach minimum damage: 25 frames → 24 frames.

- Initial bullet velocity: 22 units/frame → 27.5 units/frame.

- Frames a shot travels straight: 5 frames → 4 frames.

- Time before a shot's damage starts decreasing: 9 frames → 8 frames.

- Time to reach minimum damage: 25 frames → 24 frames.

- ▲ Now more likely to ink the area at the player's feet when firing.
If a paint droplet has not fallen within 11 units of the player for 7 shots, the next shot will force a paint droplet to appear at the player's feet.
Number of droplet patterns: 10 → 15.

- If a paint droplet has not fallen within 11 units of the player for 7 shots, the next shot will force a paint droplet to appear at the player's feet.

- Number of droplet patterns: 10 → 15.

- If a paint droplet has not fallen within 11 units of the player for 7 shots, the next shot will force a paint droplet to appear at the player's feet.

- Number of droplet patterns: 10 → 15.

- ▲ Movement speed while firing increased by 11%: 0.72 units/frame → 0.8 units/frame.

- ▲ Made it easier to ink the ground at the player's feet.
Frequency of ink splatter falling at the player's feet: 1/7 shots → 1/6 shots.

- Frequency of ink splatter falling at the player's feet: 1/7 shots → 1/6 shots.

- ▲ Increase damage dealt to opponent's brella by roughly 13%: 0.75x → 0.8x.

- ▲ Increase damage dealt to Rainmaker barrier by roughly 5%: 1.1x → 1.15x

- Frequency of ink splatter falling at the player's feet: 1/7 shots → 1/6 shots.

- ▲ Increased likelihood of paint appearing at the player's feet when shooting.

- ▼ Increased ink consumption by roughly 15%: 1% → 1.15%.

- ▼ Reduced the effect of the Main Power Up gear ability.
Changed the amount of gear ability required to deal up to 33.3 damage from 1.8 times to 2.4 times the amount of the primary gear ability.
Each secondary gear ability is worth 0.3 of the primary gear ability.

- Changed the amount of gear ability required to deal up to 33.3 damage from 1.8 times to 2.4 times the amount of the primary gear ability.

- Each secondary gear ability is worth 0.3 of the primary gear ability.

- ▼ Points to fill special gauge: 180 → 200.

- Changed the amount of gear ability required to deal up to 33.3 damage from 1.8 times to 2.4 times the amount of the primary gear ability.

- Each secondary gear ability is worth 0.3 of the primary gear ability.

The L-3 Nozzlenose D is a special model of the L-3 Nozzlenose with the maker's logo emblazoned on it! The two have the same stats, but this one pairs with Burst Bombs, letting you continually barrage your enemies! Easy to handle, the L-3 Nozzlenose(sic) is great for the aggressive player who wants to attack with precision and hit baddies with the Inkjet!

- Promotional image

The L-3 Nozzlenose D returns in Splatoon 3. It functions the same as the normal L-3 Nozzlenose, but has a different set and appearance. It has a its manufacturer's dolphin sticker on the side of the hose, as well as a light blue and white color scheme, as opposed to a darker color scheme on the original weapon. It was teased in the Fresh Season 2023 poster shown on February 16, 2023, and released on February 28, 2023. Its set consists of Burst Bomb and Ultra Stamp.

- The L-3 Nozzlenose D is a middleweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 13.5. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The ink consumption is 1.1% per shot and 3.3% per burst, allowing the user to fire 30 full bursts on a full ink tank.

- When pressing , three shots will be fired at a time, as long as there is enough ink to fire all three.
If there is not enough ink to fire all three shots, then zero, one or two shots will be fired instead, depending on how much ink is left in the ink tank.

- If there is not enough ink to fire all three shots, then zero, one or two shots will be fired instead, depending on how much ink is left in the ink tank.

- When firing a burst, a shot is fired every 4 frames.

- After the last shot in a burst is fired, another burst cannot be fired for 8 frames.

- When firing from humanoid form, the first shot takes 3 frames to come out. When firing from swim form, the first shot takes 12 frames to come out.

- When a burst is started, it takes 21 frames before the user can enter swim form or use their sub weapon.

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.08 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 25 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 31 and minimum damage of 15.5.

- If a shot is in the air for more than 8 frames after being fired, it will lose about 0.48 damage every frame until it reaches 15.5 damage at frame 40.

- The bullet hitbox for collisions with players has a radius of 0.2 units.

- The bullet hitbox for collisions with the environment has a radius of 0.2 units.

- The angle its shots can deviate while on the ground is 1 degrees.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 6 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. After 25 frames, the outer reticle will start shrinking, and will finish shrinking after 70 frames.

- The weapon starts off having a 1% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle.
This chance increases by 1% per shot, and maximizes at a 25% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle, meaning that it takes 24 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- This chance increases by 1% per shot, and maximizes at a 25% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle, meaning that it takes 24 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 40%.

- Accuracy starts recovering 4 frames after the player stops shooting. The chance to shoot towards the outer reticle decreases by 0.5% per frame, if the chance is not already at the minimum, meaning that it takes 52 frames to reach maximum accuracy. (82 after shooting while jumping.)

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 2.75 units per frame for 4 frames. Shots travel straight for 11 distance units.
After that, the shot's velocity is set to 1.568 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and it loses 36% of its speed every frame (including the first frame after it stops traveling straight). Once the shot velocity decreases below a certain threshold, it will begin to be slowed less and fall faster.

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 1.568 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and it loses 36% of its speed every frame (including the first frame after it stops traveling straight). Once the shot velocity decreases below a certain threshold, it will begin to be slowed less and fall faster.

- The effective range is about 13.52 units.
This number may vary at different firing angles.

- This number may vary at different firing angles.

- If there is not enough ink to fire all three shots, then zero, one or two shots will be fired instead, depending on how much ink is left in the ink tank.

- This chance increases by 1% per shot, and maximizes at a 25% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle, meaning that it takes 24 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 1.568 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and it loses 36% of its speed every frame (including the first frame after it stops traveling straight). Once the shot velocity decreases below a certain threshold, it will begin to be slowed less and fall faster.

- This number may vary at different firing angles.

[6]

- ▲ The reduction in damage based on how long a shot takes to reach its target is now more gradual.
Time to reach minimum damage: 24 frames → 40 frames.

- Time to reach minimum damage: 24 frames → 40 frames.

- Time to reach minimum damage: 24 frames → 40 frames.

- ▲ Maximum damage has been increased from 29.0 to 31.0.
Minimum damage: 14.5 → 15.5.

- Minimum damage: 14.5 → 15.5.

- Minimum damage: 14.5 → 15.5.

- ▲ Reduced the amount of ink consumed by approximately 4%: 1.15% → 1.1%.

The L-3 Nozzlenose D is a special model of the L-3 Nozzlenose with the maker's logo emblazoned on it! But you know that's not all... it also has a fancy-schmancy new loadout! Including Burst Bombs to weaken foes a bit before finishing 'em off with your main weapon. And the special? None other than the Ultra Stamp, guaranteed to send anyone in your path running for cover. Don't underestimate the amount of ink you can fling with this setup, but it is a quirky combo. If you feel like making a big mess and experimenting, I hope you'll give it a try!

- The L-3 Nozzlenose D being shown off in the Fresh Season 2023 promotional poster

- Promotional render

- 2D icon

- The Tableturf Battle card icon of the L-3 Nozzlenose D.

For competitive tips about the L-3 Nozzlenose D

- Across all three games, the L-3 Nozzlenose D has had Burst Bomb as its sub and various forms of an offense-based special.

The appended "D" in this weapon's name likely stands for "Dolphin", matching both the logo of its manufacturer and the dolphin theming of the base weapon's name in some languages.
